pageContext.claim: “I think the stock market, right now, would be substantially higher. And one of the reasons it's up 300 points today is that people finally got to see the transcribed letter or version of the phone call with the president of Ukraine. And everybody that saw it said, ‘Oh, this is good.’ And the market went up a lot over the last short period of time because they finally got to see it. Most people thought it was the Adam Schiff rendition, which he made up. But when they saw the letter -- you look at what's happening with the stock market right now.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump claims with no evidence that the stock market surged because he released a transcript of his call with the Ukrainian president on July 25, which later became key evidence in Congress's impeachment inquiry into Trump.
